query: Read the file at C:\Users\User\test.txt and show me its contents
response: Reading files requires @agent mode with Filesystem access.

The trust hierarchy ranks information sources by reliability: tool-verified data (from live tool execution) is highest, followed by workspace RAG context (curated deployment-specific knowledge), Memory knowledge graph (local persistent facts), and finally training knowledge (general, potentially outdated information). When sources conflict, use the higher-ranked source. Tool-returned dates and timestamps are current reality, not stale data.
